A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: (Spoiler Free) As a movie\, I thought it was fine. Good visuals\, amazing score\, etc. However\, it really didn't feel like a star wars movie. It felt out of place\, like Johnson either hadn't seen another star wars movie or just didn't care. I feel like he had a completely different vision for the series than Abrams did and got started in ep VIII. The tone was off (from other sw movies)\, it felt choppy\, and I felt like there wasn't a real heart or core to the movie. Many of the characters seemed off or out of character. I also felt like there were too many things done/said JUST for the sake of being funny/for comic relief\, which felt weird to me (like\, this isn't a marvel movie!!). Many of the scenes and relationships hyped up in trailers/promos fell flat. One of the major plot points was completely pointless\, which was annoying considering how long the movie was. There were good scenes\, but a lot of them felt overshadowed by the bad ones. Overall\, especially considering how hyped up this movie was by critics\, I was disappointed. (Hopefully Abrams can fix things in ep IX)
